meanings.definition: Having or showing symptoms of fever.
meanings.sent1: The doctor confirmed her feverous condition.
meanings.sent2: The thermometer indicated a feverous temperature.
meanings.sent3: Despite feeling feverous, she still managed to smile.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was feverous, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The red, hot cheeks were a clear sign of her feverous state.

meanings.sent1: The feverous illness spread quickly through the school.
meanings.sent2: The mosquito bite left a feverous red mark on her arm.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food had a feverous effect on his taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the desert was feverous, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The feverous outbreak led to many people seeking medical help.

meanings.definition: Marked by intense emotion or activity.
meanings.sent1: The feverous excitement before the concert was palpable.
meanings.sent2: Her feverous passion for painting was evident in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent3: The feverous debate in the courtroom kept everyone on edge.
meanings.sent4: The feverous energy of the crowd at the game was contagious.
meanings.sent5: His feverous determination to succeed drove him to work tirelessly.
